text: Grusha, Marty and Tal's paper on syntactic priming for studying neural network representations is accepted to CoNLL.
Marty, Aaron Mueller, and Tal's paper on data efficiency of neural network language models is accepted to EMNLP.
Tal is giving a keynote talk at the Conference on Formal Grammar in Riga
Tal is participating in the Workshop on Compositionality in Brains and Machines in Leiden
Tal is co-organizing the BlackboxNLP 2019workshop at ACL
Karl Mulligan joins the lab as a PhD student, and Junghyun Min joins the lab as a Masters student
Tal and Yoav Goldberg were awarded a grant by the US-Israel Binational Science Foundation.
Keynote talk at the Workshop on Evaluating Vector Space Representations for NLP (RepEval) at NAACL. Slides.
Tal gave talks at Waseda University and the RIKEN Institute in Tokyo
Paper on syntactic heuristics in neural language inference systems accepted to ACL
Upcoming keynote talk at Midwest Speech and Language Days
Upcoming talk at the Cognitive Talk Series at Princeton
Tal gave a talk at the CompLang seminar at MIT
Tal received a Google Faculty Research Award
Tal gave LTI colloquium talk at Carnegie Mellon University
Grusha had two abstracts accepted for CUNY 2019, one with Tal and the other with Tal and Marty
Marty gave a presentation at SCiL
Tal gave talks over winter break at Yale Linguistics (December 10), Microsoft Research Redmond (December 13), Allen AI Institue (December 14), and Google New York (January 7).
